agency_name: NATIONAL MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS SOCIETY - INDIANA STATE CHAPTER
agency_desc: The Indiana Chapter of a national nonprofit agency working to address the challenges of people affected by multiple sclerosis and to promote research for a cure.
site_name: NATIONAL MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS SOCIETY - INDIANA STATE CHAPTER
service_description: Helps registered people with multiple sclerosis (MS) obtain durable medical equipment and home modification.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: People with multiple sclerosis (MS) -- With physician prescription

service_description: Offers educational seminars, workshops, literature, and information about multiple sclerosis (MS) to clients, their families, and the community.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.

agency_desc: The Department of Veterans Affairs provides veterans with health care and benefits.
service_description: Provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient health care services to qualified veterans, including doctor's visits, laboratory work, surgery, rehabilitation, pharmacy services, and primary and specialty care services. Co-pay determined by benefits and income.
site_details: New Patients: Visit the website, call, or walk in to the Registrar office at the hospital to complete  an Application for Health Care Benefits. -- Returning Patients (and new patients who have received a letter of approval): Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Eligibility Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Hospital: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US Veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working toward a world free of Multiple Sclerosis.
service_description: Connect to doctors and resources in your community, including attorneys, home care aides, adaptive vehicles and more, to address the unique challenges of living with MS.
